title: Taking off: what’s new in the world
text:
The rooftop pool at the Old Clare Hotel, Sydney Atherton’s opening in Oz
The architect Tim Greer says of his latest project, the Old Clare Hotel, in Sydney: “You will get a sense that the building is dressing and undressing itself all at once. Some parts are exquisite and other parts are raw.” What he should have said is: “Next month, we’re opening a 62-room luxury hotel at an old brewery and pub in the hip Chippendale district. It’s got a pool on the roof. Oh, and Jason Atherton is doing the cooking, with his first Australian restaurant, Kensington Street Social.” Architects, eh?
Doubles from £162; theoldclarehotel.com.au
Pomme voyage
With apologies for getting all autumnal on you (we blame the weather), here’s a fruity offering from Sawday’s. The company has created two itineraries showcasing the best of Normandy’s cider and calvados country. You can visit distilleries, explore picturesque orchards and enjoy tastings in cider houses before sleeping it off
